definition: erhua variant of 鐵哥們|铁哥们[tie3 ge1 men5]
iron (metal)/arms/weapons/hard/strong/violent/unshakeable/determined/close/tight (slang)
surname Tie
elder brother
plural marker for pronouns, and nouns referring to individuals
variant of 人[ren2]/"person" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 10), occurring in 兒, 兀, 兄 etc
child/son
non-syllabic diminutive suffix/retroflex final

sentences.english: You’re in love with your best friend’s ex and she is in love with you.
sentences.chinese: 你爱上了自己铁哥们儿的前女友，而她也爱着你。

sentences.english: You’re in love with your best friend’s ex, and she is in love with you.
sentences.chinese: 你爱上了你铁哥们儿的前女友，而她也爱着你。

definition: (coll.) very close male friends
best friends/inseparable sidekick/diehard followers
(dialect) close childhood friend whom one grew up with/a couple who grew up as childhood friends
erhua variant of 髮小|发小[fa4 xiao3]
good friend/(slang) a visit from Aunt Flo (menstrual period)
a friend in times of tribulations (idiom); a friend in need is a friend indeed
brothers/younger brother/CL:個|个[ge4]/I, me (humble term used by men in public speech)/brotherly/fraternal
a pack of rogues (idiom); a gang of scoundrels
intimate friendship/bosom buddies
as close as one's hands and feet (idiom); loving one another as brothers/deep friendship/closely attached to one another
lit. drinking buddy (idiom)/fig. fair-weather friend
best friend
(coll.) wife's younger brother
not to hold anything back (idiom)/(of close friends etc) to tell each other everything
male cousins via female line
younger male cousin via female line
